messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Digest Number 941
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 7/17/2003 6:49:57 AM Eastern Standard Time, ... Yes, of course, but what I meant wasn t that that was the only reason that The Beatles chose
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 7/17/2003 6:49:57 AM Eastern Standard Time,
AlwaysLearning@yahoogroups.com writes:

> Ah, I know this! It's spelled that way because the group was modeled after
> >the Beatles, and the Beatles changes the spelling of their name so it'd be
> >different from the bug.
> >
> >
>
> More like the Beatles changed it so it would have something to do with
> music!
>
> Beat.
> Mersey Beat.
> Beatles.
>
>
Yes, of course, but what I meant wasn't that that was the only reason that
The Beatles chose that spelling (keep in mind that it was early when I wrote
this--remember the Anne Murray post?) but that the Monkees did that because they
were modeled on the Beatles.

Oh, never mind.

Kathryn


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
